AccountsOption.description: AccountsOption describes an optional deviation to an apko environment's run-as setting.

BuildOption.description: BuildOption describes an optional deviation to an apko environment.

ContentsOption.description: ContentsOption describes an optional deviation to an apko environment's contents block.

groupname.description: Required: The name of the group

members.description: Required: The list of members of the group

run-as.description: Required: The user to run the container as. This can be a username or UID.

users.description: Required: List of users to populate the image with

groups.description: Required: List of groups to populate the image with

contents.description: Required: The apk packages in the container image

entrypoint.description:
Required: The entrypoint of the container image

This typically is the path to the executable to run. Since many of
images do not include a shell, this should be the full path
to the executable.

cmd.description:
Optional: The command of the container image

These are the additional arguments to pass to the entrypoint.

stop-signal.description: Optional: The stop signal used to suspend the execution of the containers process

work-dir.description: Optional: The working directory of the container

accounts.description: Optional: Account configuration for the container image

archs.description:
Optional: List of CPU architectures to build the container image for

The list of supported architectures is: 386, amd64, arm64, arm/v6, arm/v7, ppc64le, riscv64, s390x

environment.description: Optional: Envionment variables to set in the container image

os-release.description: Optional: The /etc/os-release configuration for the container image

vcs-url.description: Optional: The link to version control system for this container's source code

annotations.description: Optional: Annotations to apply to the images manifests

include.description:
Optional: Path to a local file containing additional image configuration

The included configuration is deep merged with the parent configuration

options.description:
Optional: A map of named build option deviations

Deprecated: Use WithExtraPackages.

volumes.description:
Optional: A list of volumes to configure

This is _not_ the same as Paths, but refers to the OCI spec "volumes"
field used by some container runtimes (docker) to create volumes at
runtime. For most use cases, this is not needed, but consider using this
when the image requires special volume configuration at runtime for
supported container runtimes.

repositories.description: A list of apk repositories to use for pulling packages

keyring.description: A list of public keys used to verify the desired repositories

packages.description: A list of packages to include in the image

type.description: Optional: The type of entrypoint. Only "service-bundle" is supported.

command.description: Required: The command of the entrypoint

shell-fragment.description: Optional: The shell fragment of the entrypoint command

ListOption.description: ListOption describes an optional deviation to a list, for example, a list of packages.

name.description: Optional: The name of the OS

id.description: Optional: The unique identifier for the OS

version-id.description: Optional: The unique identifier for the version of the OS

pretty-name.description: Optional: The human readable description of the OS

home-url.description: Optional: The URL of the homepage for the OS

bug-report-url.description: Optional: The URL of the bug reporting website for the OS

type.description:
The type of mutation to perform

This can be one of: directory, empty-file, hardlink, symlink, permissions

permissions.description: The permission bits for the path

username.description: Required: The name of the user
